body:
This needs to be ported over from the s3 backend. 

@msays2000 do you want to have a go at this? Or maybe you'd like to @jmichler ?
@ncw yes I can provide support for it, i will try to find another collaborator on oracle backend support. If I cannot find some collaborators in couple of weeks, I can provide the code.
@msays2000 great. Should you need any support/testing with a Oracle Backend let me know. I know a bunch of things on OCI but nothing on the implementation of rclone itself unfortunately

@jmichler FYI, I assume you want rclone to just trigger the restore of a object if not already restoring and not wait for it as it will be useless to wait for 1 hour. 

```
Restore an object from Archive Storage to Object Storage.

Depending on the size of the object, it can take at most an hour to restore an object from Archive Storage. You can’t download an item object until the item is fully restored.

By default, you have 24 hours to download an object after restoration. Alternatively, you can specify a download time from 1 to 240 hours. You can find out how much download time is remaining by looking at the Available for Download value in the object’s details. 
```

@msays2000 the question is if a sync would trigger it implicitly or if we have a dedicated "restore" command. I think for s3 the approach is the latter one, then probably the user would need to issue the restore first and then a sync would fail if documents are not (yet) available in non-archive-storage.
How is this solved for AWS glacier?

yes its the later one, where one needs to execute restore command first and then a sync would fail if documents are not (yet) available in non-archive-storage.

behavior is same as aws glacier.
@msays2000 is this still looking for a contributor?

> @msays2000 is this still looking for a contributor?

Yes, we are still looking for contributors. I can contribute, but trying to get some more contributors.

issue.title: oracleobjectstorage: Support "backend restore" command - fixes #7371

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?
Fixes bug: #7371
Add support for "backend restore" command for Oracle Object Storage.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?
Yes, #7371
